column4: gnome shell crashed on me (11.10) and is not reloading.  i dont have a window manager or anything, but I can start programs (but not switch between them) by browsing the filesystem and double clicking the executables.  given that, how do i restart gnome-shell?
since gnome-shell was crashing on me once a minute I actually put into terminal   while((1));do gnome-shell;done
thanks ill kill chromium and try that
how is XFCE?  I tried it years ago and it seemed to be horrendously outdated and nothing was integrated...
can't hurt to install it if you have 125MiB to burn
BTW. another thing I hated about gnome-shell - I like translucent terminals, but junk on my desktop and in windows behind them makes it hard to read the text
in Unity and gnome2 w/ compiz, you can enable blurring of translucent windows
ah, thanks, the mouse travel in G3 and the number of clicks to do anything in unity is driving me up a wall.  ill see what i can do with XFCE.
breaks up sharp lines in text behind terminal windows - as far as I can tell, this is impossible in gnome-shell
gnome-shell was more usable w/ the mint gnome shell extensions
you can get those from the webupd8 ppa
yeah, i dont know why theyre in love with that, it really has to be a subtle blending to work well
